intro: Satureja cristata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja cristata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
